alert.note: Alert for Graham (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 10 at 2:30AM CDT until June 10 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR EASTERN GRAHAM COUNTY... At 230 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Although the rain has ended, flooding will likely continue for several hours. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hill City, Bogue and Nicodemus. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
